Articles.Content: I highly doubt we will be getting mods.  Not impossible, but not very likely.   I’m surprised that was even mentioned in that article as the lack of mods had nothing to do with why the game was taken down from the store.   It was taken down because it was broken.   Not having mods isn’t even a valid complaint.  When you decide to be a console player you pretty much accept games are not going to be modable. ( yeah there are a few but it’s not common practice, at least not yet).

2 hours ago, AndyChilly said:

So a lil news snippet from Windows Central website states that 'The Kerbal team later made the game unavailable to purchase for Xbox One due to a number of complaints from gamers, ranging from corrupted saves and no mod availability.'

Does that mean that this website are under the impression the Enhanced Edition will have mod availability?

As far as we are aware it wont will it? I mean they would never keep that big of juicy info to themselves?

 

58 minutes ago, OrganizedChaos said:

I highly doubt we will be getting mods.  Not impossible, but not very likely.   I’m surprised that was even mentioned in that article as the lack of mods had nothing to do with why the game was taken down from the store.   It was taken down because it was broken.   Not having mods isn’t even a valid complaint.  When you decide to be a console player you pretty much accept games are not going to be modable. ( yeah there are a few but it’s not common practice, at least not yet).

I agree Organized Chaos but nonetheless I find it intriguing that they would mention no mods on a platform that doesn't support mods. It's like if they took down MineCraft and then said it was because of glitches and no mods it makes no sense it's a console and seeing as it is a post from MICROSOFT. Might hint to a exeption. I'm also pretty sure you can use the web on console so... Maby?

4 minutes ago, Cheif Operations Director said:

I agree Organized Chaos but nonetheless I find it intriguing that they would mention no mods on a platform that doesn't support mods. It's like if they took down MineCraft and then said it was because of glitches and no mods it makes no sense it's a console and seeing as it is a post from MICROSOFT. Might hint to a exeption. I'm also pretty sure you can use the web on console so... Maby?

I play Skyrim Special Edition on xbox one which allows mods and bethesda really pulled it off well....there is a huge library of mods to add to the game and a load order screen to make sure they are running in the right order. my skyrim has about 50 mods to it so it does work. and i feel it works well.

Mods would be really nice but bethesda is only company so far that support them, as  far as  i know.

 

KER would just be so nice so u dont have to Do the math by yourself.

1 hour ago, AndyChilly said:

I play Skyrim Special Edition on xbox one which allows mods and bethesda really pulled it off well....there is a huge library of mods to add to the game and a load order screen to make sure they are running in the right order. my skyrim has about 50 mods to it so it does work. and i feel it works well.

I've played Skyrim with mods as well on PS4( despite limitations Sony put on them) and they do work fine, hence why I believe it is possible.   Though Bethesda has a been doing this quite a bit longer (PC and console development) then Squad and with the difficulties they have had with the port I'd be pretty surprised to see mod support.  At least right now.  Look how long it took for them to get mod support after release for Fallout and that was planned.   I'm just saying no one should get there hopes up at this point, after all we don't even know if we're getting the DLC ( I'm pretty hopeful we will because it's more likely then not).  Not to mention with the game now in the certification process and no mention of mod support is pretty telling.  At this point getting a game that runs well and works is at the top of there priority and throwing mods into that now seems like a risk to the integrity of the game they shouldn't be taking right now.

On 12/18/2017 at 10:30 AM, OrganizedChaos said:

I've played Skyrim with mods as well on PS4( despite limitations Sony put on them) and they do work fine, hence why I believe it is possible.   Though Bethesda has a been doing this quite a bit longer (PC and console development) then Squad and with the difficulties they have had with the port I'd be pretty surprised to see mod support.  At least right now.  Look how long it took for them to get mod support after release for Fallout and that was planned.   I'm just saying no one should get there hopes up at this point, after all we don't even know if we're getting the DLC ( I'm pretty hopeful we will because it's more likely then not).  Not to mention with the game now in the certification process and no mention of mod support is pretty telling.  At this point getting a game that runs well and works is at the top of there priority and throwing mods into that now seems like a risk to the integrity of the game they shouldn't be taking right now.

Can't wait for the weekly

Don’t think “mods”, “mods” change the game and thus are bad.

think “DLC”, “DLC” changes the game, and thus is good.

Ooh, news:

The release is in certification, which means precise dates are entirely within Sony/Microsoft's hands now.

Good news, hopefully the extended testing means it will be in the wild for at least a few days before someone finds a way to break it and even then the more trivial stuff actually works...

Looking forwards to a restart
